meanings.definition: A unit of ionizing radiation dose in the International System of Units (SI).
meanings.sent1: Doctors use sieverts to measure the amount of radiation a patient receives during treatment.
meanings.sent2: The Geiger counter detected high levels of sieverts in the contaminated area.
meanings.sent3: When the scientist accidentally spilled the radioactive material, he exclaimed, 'Oh no, we've got sieverts everywhere!'
meanings.sent4: The impact of the nuclear disaster was so severe that the entire region was saturated with sieverts.
meanings.sent5: The concept of sieverts helps us understand the potential harm of exposure to radiation.

meanings.definition: A measure of the health effect of low levels of ionizing radiation on the human body.
meanings.sent1: After the X-ray, the doctor explained the dosage in sieverts to the worried patient.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying the long-term effects of low-level sieverts exposure on workers in nuclear plants.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character joked, 'I must have absorbed too many sieverts from that glowing green potion!'
meanings.sent4: The anxiety of the impending radiation test felt like a cloud of sieverts hanging over her head.
meanings.sent5: The educational video vividly illustrated the impact of sieverts on human health.
